title: How Eddie Jones' ruthless training sessions helped England get their discipline back
text:
During England’s warm-weather training camp in Treviso last month, Eddie Jones decided to swap his role as head coach to referee a full-blown 15-a-side match situation involving his entire World Cup squad.

Jones, according to accounts, was sharp on his whistle. Any sign of indiscipline was ruthlessly dealt with. If Jones felt the indiscretion warranted a yellow card, the player dismissed to the touchlines and his side had to continue the intense session with only 14 men.

Worse still, the offender was not only merely removed from the contest but had to spend his time away from the action being “flogged” with exhausting exercises.
